May 11, 1961
Mr. Harold Hill, Vice President
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
1346 Connecticut Avenue, N.W.
Washington 6, D.C.
Dear Mr. Hill:
Enclosed you will find a copy of the response of the Governor of Michigan
to the request from Representative Oren Harris, Chairman of the Committee
on Inter-State and Foreign Commerce. May I suggest that the most rapid
action will be achieved by contacting persons in the capital of Michigan
rather than in Detroit, which is 85 miles away.
The State of Michigan has had a "Working Committee on Educational
Television" for three years. Dr. Armand L. Hunter is a member of that
committee and Mr. Larry Frymire is often called to work with this group.
I understand that both of these men are representatives of the NAEB and
both are located in the capital city of Michigan. The advantages of
contacting nearby people or interested persons in the vicinity will
guarantee more rapid action that persons in the Detroit area.
You may count on my cooperation in any future needs you may have. For
your information, the chairman of the working committee and myself were
in the Governor's office drafting the enclosed reply when a telephone call
from Detroit interrupted.
Best of luck in future developments with Federal aid to ETV.
Sincerely,
Associate Professor
